item.title: Machine Learning Engineer
item.description: Optimizing ML and LLM workflows, including text style transfer, while enhancing data handling for scalable advertising.

item.title: Style Transfer in Text - Exploration and Evaluation
item.description: This paper explores text style transfer (TST) using non-parallel data, introducing new evaluation metrics for transfer strength and content preservation.

item.title: Text Style Transfer - A Review and Experimental Evaluation
item.description: A comprehensive review of text style transfer (TST) techniques, their evaluation, and benchmarking results across various datasets.

item.title: Binary Search
item.description: Binary search, your go-to algorithm

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks for Machine Learning Models
item.description: Analyzed ML vulnerabilities with pipelines, metrics, and visualizations.

item.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
item.description: Researching privacy vulnerabilities in ML and LLMs to advance ethical AI practices.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks for Large Language Models
item.description: Advanced the understanding of privacy risks in LLMs by extending prior work with new attacks and experiments.

item.title: Label Inference Attacks in Federated Learning
item.description: Optimized label attacks and assessed risks in federated learning.

item.title: Resident Assistant
item.description: Building community and supporting residents at RPI.

item.title: Course Mentor for Machine Learning from Data
item.description: Mentored students and provided feedback in ML coursework.

item.title: Does Label Differential Privacy Prevent Label Inference Attacks?
item.description: Analyzes the effectiveness of label-DP in mitigating label inference attacks and provides insights on privacy settings and attack bounds.

item.title: Using LLMs to Uncover Memorization in Instruction-Tuned Models
item.description: A study introducing a black-box prompt optimization approach to uncover higher levels of memorization in instruction-tuned LLMs.

item.title: Defending Batch-Level Label Inference and Replacement Attacks in Vertical Federated Learning
item.description: Explores vulnerabilities in VFL models to label inference and backdoor attacks and proposes effective defenses like CAE and DCAE.

item.title: Label Inference Attacks Against Vertical Federated Learning
item.description: Evaluates privacy risks of vertical federated learning (VFL) and proposes label inference attacks with outstanding performance, highlighting vulnerabilities and defense limitations.

item.title: AI Camp Mentor
item.description: Guided teens in learning AI concepts and applications remotely.

item.title: Do Membership Inference Attacks Work on Large Language Models?
item.description: This paper evaluates the effectiveness of membership inference attacks on large language models, revealing that such attacks often perform no better than random guessing.

item.title: Practical Membership Inference Attacks Against Large-Scale Multi-Modal Models - A Pilot Study
item.description: An investigation of membership inference attacks (MIAs) targeting large-scale multi-modal models like CLIP, introducing practical attack strategies without shadow training.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks Against Fine-tuned Large Language Models via Self-prompt Calibration
item.description: A novel study introducing self-prompt calibration for membership inference attacks (MIAs) against fine-tuned large language models, improving reliability and practicality in privacy assessments.

item.title: Handwriting Digits Recognition
item.description: Achieved high precision in handwritten digit classification through ML optimization.

item.title: FamilyPlus - A Healthcare Platform
item.description: Built an AI and blockchain platform for secure, accessible health data.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks Against NLP Classification Models
item.description: A comprehensive analysis of privacy risks in NLP classification models, focusing on membership inference attacks (MIAs) at both sample and user levels.

item.title: Attention Is All You Need
item.description: Proposed the Transformer model, a novel architecture using self-attention to improve sequence transduction tasks.

item.title: Operating Systems Simulation
item.description: Simulated an operating system and optimized CPU scheduling algorithms for performance analysis.

item.title: Wordle Game
item.description: Developed a multi-threaded Wordle server with efficient protocols.

item.title: Campus Connect Hub
item.description: Built a platform for event management and user engagement with Agile/Scrum practices.

item.title: HassPathway - Course Navigation Platform
item.description: Built a tool to simplify and display course data with an intuitive interface.

A recent graduate from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) with a degree in Computer Science and a minor in Economics. My focus has been on Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Software Development.

I have worked as a Research Assistant in the Data Security and Privacy Lab, studying privacy vulnerabilities in machine learning models and large language models (LLMs). I also gained experience with Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and full-stack development through projects and research.
